intro: Peucedanum sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian cowparsley, is a perennial herb native to the cold climates of Siberia and Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
